revised_title: Electron Diffraction in Gases: A New Approach to Analyzing Molecular Structure
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the diffraction of electrons in gases, demonstrating that diffraction patterns can be used to analyze the structure of complex molecules, similar to how X-ray diffraction patterns reveal crystal structures. The results showed distinct diffraction patterns in rare gases, while diatomic gases and more complex molecules did not exhibit clear diffraction maxima. This suggests a new method for examining the structure of complex molecules by analyzing electron diffraction patterns in scattered electrons.
